content: The "Seven-Year Balanced Budget Enforcement Act of 1995" extends and reduces discretionary spending limits and extends pay-as-you-go requirements. The "Seven-Year Balanced Budget Enforcement Act of 1995" extends and reduces discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1996-1999. The "Seven-Year Balanced Budget Enforcement Act of 1995" extends and reduces discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1996-1999. It includes specific budget authority and outlay amounts for fiscal years 1999 to 2002. Amendments are made to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to update committee allocations and enforcement measures. Amendments are made to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to update committee allocations and enforcement measures for fiscal years 1996 to 2002. Amendments are made to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to update committee allocations and enforcement measures for fiscal years 1996 to 2002. Section 251A(b)(1) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to specify funding amounts for fiscal years 1996 to 2000. Section 310002 of the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 is repealed. SEC. 3. GENERAL STATEMENT AND DEFINITIONS. Section 250 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to enforce deficit reduction by adjusting discretionary spending limits through fiscal year 2002 and extending pay-as-you-go requirements permanently. Definitions for "category" are updated to include all discretionary appropriations for different fiscal years. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to adjust discretionary spending limits through fiscal year 2002 and extend pay-as-you-go requirements permanently. Definitions for "budgetary resources" are updated to include new budget authority, unobligated balances, direct spending authority, and obligation limitations. SEC. 4. ENFORCING DISCRETIONARY SPENDING LIMITS. Section 251 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to adjust fiscal years and remove certain subparagraphs. Section 251 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to adjust fiscal years and remove certain subparagraphs, such as changing clauses and limits for fiscal years 1996 through 2002. SEC. 5. ENFORCING PAY-AS-YOU-GO. Amends Section 252 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to extend and update pay-as-you-go provisions. SEC. 6. REPORTS AND ORDERS. SEC. 6. REPORTS AND ORDERS. Amends Section 254 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to update reporting requirements and orders. SEC. 7. TECHNICAL CORRECTION. Repeals Section 258 of the Act regarding the modification of Presidential orders. SEC. 8. SPECIAL RULE ON INTERRELATIONSHIP BETWEEN CHANGES IN DISCRETIONARY SPENDING LIMITS AND PAY-AS-YOU-GO REQUIREMENTS. Section 252 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include a special rule on the interrelationship between sections 251, 251A, and 252. This rule states that any legislation decreasing discretionary spending limits will be treated as direct spending legislation decreasing the deficit for that fiscal year. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include a special rule regarding discretionary spending limits. This rule specifies reductions in spending limits for fiscal years 1999 through 2002, measured from the limit in fiscal year 1998. The Act amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to include reductions in discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1996 through 2000. Reductions in spending limits for any fiscal year after the enactment of this Act will be measured as reductions from the discretionary spending limit for that year. The Act amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to include reductions in discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1996 through 2000. Reductions in spending limits for any fiscal year after the enactment of this Act will be measured against the discretionary spending limit for the last fiscal year with a spending limit in effect. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to change the expiration date to 2002. Additionally, a section of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 is repealed.
